page.title: 18CROPS IN L. STAUGHTON
page.content: Some winter monoculture is practised, but a large proportion of the area includes a break crop in rotation,especially winter oilseed rape, obvious in the early summer months due to its bright yellow flower,with some winter and spring field beans and harvest dried peas. There is little permanent or temporary {grassland.}There are virtually no {sheep}and very few beef cattle. There are at least two small{dairy herds, predominantly Friesian. There is little evidence of intensive{pig}or {chicken farming}in the area. . Other farming activities include some relatively small scale{vegetable growing, particularly brussels sprouts and potatoes. There is a{goat farm situated in Little Staughton, famous for its pedigree milking herd.
